text: Michael go first of all just days ago
you were backing Boris Johnson in fact
running his campaign why have you
changed your mind
well I thought it was right that
following the decision at the British
people took last week but we should have
someone leading the Conservative Party
and leading the country who believed in
their heart and soul the Britain was
better off outside the European Union
and I hoped that Boris Johnson would be
someone who could ensure that the
government followed the instructions of
the British people and also build and
unite a team around him in order to lead
this country forward and Boris is an
amazing and an impressive person but
I've realized in the last few days that
Boris is incapable of building that team
and providing that unity and so I came
reluctantly but firmly to the conclusion
that as someone who had argued from the
beginning that we should leave the
European Union and as someone who wanted
to ensure that a bold positive vision
for our future was implemented that I
had to stand for the leadership of the
Conservative Party what was it that
changed your mind though I mean you have
known Boris Johnson for a very long time
it can't be the case that you've
suddenly only realized what his
attributes are or and indeed his faults
are or his lack of ability in certain
areas Boris is a big character with
great abilities and I enjoyed working
with him during the referendum campaign
when he campaigned the great energy and
enthusiasm but there is something
special about leading a party and
leading a country and I had the
opportunity in the last few days to
assess whether or not Boris good leave
that team and build that unity I came as
I say reluctantly but firmly to the
conclusion that while Boris has many
talents and attributes he wasn't capable
of building that team and there were a
number of people who had said to me
during the course of the week Michael it
should be you I reflected on those
comments I reflected on the individuals
who'd made that case and I came last
night as I say with a degree of
hesitation but ultimately believing that
this was absolutely the right thing to
do I came to the conclusion but it was
necessary to put myself forward we need
leading the Conservative Party and the
country at the moment someone with
experience at the highest reaches of God
we need someone who believes in the
British people's verdict that they
delivered last week we need someone who
can appeal to and unite individuals who
argued that we should leave and who also
believed that we should remain in the
European Union and already today I've
had support from colleagues across that
spectrum and indeed from outside
politics that confirms my belief that I
was right to stand to offer myself up
for election and although my colleagues
in the Conservative Party to make a
judgment about whether or not I am right
to lead and what kind of Prime Minister
would you be I mean what would your
priorities be I would want to be captain
of a strong team the first thing to do
is to recognize that we need to draw on
all the talents that the Conservative
Party has indeed we need to draw on all
the talents in the country I want to
lead a government in which people with
wise heads and generous hearts work
together in order to ensure that the
decision that the British people made on
the European Union is honored that means
that first and foremost we need to take
this country out of the European Union
and into the world we need to restore
parliamentary control of our borders
taxes and laws but above all we need to
build a much more dynamic economy and a
fairer society when people voted to
leave the European Union last week they
were voting for change and there are far
too many people in our country who felt
that recent economic growth and renewed
prosperity hasn't touched their lives
there are far too many people in this
country who felt left behind and
overlooked as the world moves forward at
a faster pace
I want to govern for everyone in this
country I wanted to heal and unite and
above all I wanted to ensure that
Britain is a country that others look to
with admiration because we're the home
of innovation and creativity but we're
also a warm and compassionate place that
everyone is proud to call home ok thank
you very much indeed
